results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories to remember”.
Sigourney Weaver narrates Andersen’s moving story of a young girl’s quest for her young friend who has been captured by the beautiful but heartless Snow Queen and taken to her icy palace far from humankind. Along the way she makes new friends who help her in her search. Based on Susan Jeffers’ illustrations for the picture book adaptation by Amy Ehrlich.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow

group_works.title: I own the racecourse
group_works.creator_credit: Darrol Blake, Anna Home and Learning Corporation of America

group_works.title: Little pig
group_works.creator_credit: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV

results.title: Little pig
results.creator_credit: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
Upon her mother’s death a young Chinese girl is left alone to care for her infant brother. Against a background of the colourful city of Hong Kong, this film depicts their travels to reach an unknown aunt, only to discover that family struggling to make ends meet. In desperation the girl is driven to theft, but through the efforts of an understanding Confucian scribe she is saved from disgrace and learns a valuable lesson in human relations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV

results.title: I own the racecourse
results.creator_credit: Darrol Blake, Anna Home and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
A heartwarming and humorous story from the novel by Patricia Wrightson. Set in Sydney, a backward child named Andy buys a racecourse for three dollars from a tramp.

results.title: Ithal Damat = Imported groom
results.creator_credit: Huseyin Duman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Huseyin Damat left Turkey for Australia to meet and marry his wife. Although he was sad to leave his family behind, his journey here was an eventful one, especially when he discovered he was on the same flight as Swedish super group ABBA.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Huseyin Duman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: New life new country
results.creator_credit: Fatma Coskun, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fatma Coskun came from a small village amongst the mountains of Corun. However, financial hardships drove her and her husband to Australia to start a new life. Despite a major setback at the beginning of their journey, Fatma and her family consider themselves very fortunate to have settled in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fatma Coskun, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Stories from the Turkish community : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Ifran Hassan, Mustafa Yucel, Umit Ugur, Bayram Ocal, Yusuf Hazar, Figen Hasimoglu, Memet Gunes, Riza Guclu, Huseyin Duman, Fatma Coskun, Kenan Besiroglu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven Turkish migrants, from Cyprus and Turkey, tell of their experiences migrating and making Australia their new home. They tell of the reasons for moving here, the journey to Australia and share their feelings for their family, their community and their adopted country.

results.title: Yeni hayat = New life
results.creator_credit: Kenan Besiroglu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kenan Besiroglu migrated to Australia with his wife and son in 1970. This is a story of hard work, perseverance and the promise of a new life.

results.title: Yeni dunyam = My new world
results.creator_credit: Yusuf Hazar, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Migrating to Australia from Ankara, Turkey in 1978, Yusuf Hazar fondly looks back on the life he and his wife created for his six children. Feeling a deep sense of gratitude to his adopted country, Yusuf and his family are committed to helping out others in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yusuf Hazar, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
